intro: Selliera fasciculata, commonly known as the mountain star or fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, which bloom during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
